title: Instead of rework hybrid champs into linear AD or AP, how about we rework hybrid itemization?
body:
Honestly, if Riot just took their time to rework the whole hybrid itemization/tank resistance/hybrid system then balancing hybrid champs would not be so hard.


It sucks when a champ like Evelyn complete loses half of her scalings with a rework. And she is not only one. Riot has been doing it slowly on all their reworks. 

Makes me scared to see what they will do to {{champion:82}}  next year. I almost rather they left him as is if they plan to continue this trend.

Anyway, the point is, stop destroying hybrid champs. They offer a lot of diversity to the game and riot should take advantage of that.

Going for items like Duskblade, Yommus, Edge of Night has been an option for a long time now. With the changes she won't be able to build that way anymore. That's why losing that itemization sucks. Evelynn is and always has been an assassin, not a diver as some people like to claim. New Evelynn can still be an assassin with AD ratios. Having AD ratios doesn't suddenly change her class.

The current most popular build for Eve is Runic Echos/Blue Smite + Protobelt + Lichbane. After that is Runic Echos/Blue Smite + Gunblade + Lichbane. While Duskblade is picked up in ~9% of Eve games, Yommus is picked up in ~0.8% of Eve games, behind Deadmans, ~8.9%, Trinity Force, ~6.1%, and Titanic Hydra, ~2.6%. If Eve builds a Duskblade, a Trinity Force, then a Deadmans, that's not assassin, that's bruiser. Using Evelynn as a diver was actually pretty decent, since you could stack big shields, putting out pretty good DPS with Trinity Force and your Q. While I dislike the fact that Eve is losing ratios, Riot's reasoning makes perfect sense.

Back in my days, AD only increases AA damage, AP is used to increase spell damage. Hybrid scaling means a champ is both scale-able via increasing AA (AD) and spell (AP) damage.

Then AD scaling in spells became a thing.

Well I guess with all things considered, it wasn't a bad move. But then, it makes the distinction between AD and AP kinda redundant.

OK let me ask you a question first. What's the point of being an Hybrid champ in the first place?

Real question, I'm not trolling. I have strong feelings about Hybrid Items, but I'll let you reply first.

well for one people just seem to like things for liking them...
but in a more serious answer its both because its very difficult to itemize against hybrid damage since there arent enough mr/armor items
 and just for the pure novelty

Well, none of that sounds like a good and healthy reason to me.

Far as I can see, there is one good reason to have a champion be Hybrid: flexibility in their build paths. (But if you have other reasons to add to the list, I'm still open.)

Problem is, if you want to preserve this flexibility in build paths for hybrid **Champions**, you need to get rid of hybrid **Items**. If Hybrid Items are any good, then Hybrid Champs aren't flexible anymore, they are forced into buying the couple items that are specifically tailored to them, and it's even worse, you have even less flexibility than being only AP or only AD.

So no, we shouldn't rework hybrid items. Like, at all.

And when you look closely at it, the few Hybrid Items we have aren't Items tailored to Hybrid champs, no, they're just Hybrid to make them purposely gold-inefficient for the majority of the roster, in order to ensure we can control who get access to their super powerful/game-warping Passives.

___

A quick word on Eve's specific case, even if I'm no expert. The problem with Eve being Hybrid is that giving flexibility to Assassins most often means giving Assassins the possibility to play Bruisers without counter-play. See "Tank" Akali, Ekko, Fizz, etc. And we use to call them "Tank", but the word isn't right, they are durable but they make horrible Tanks, they are more like heavy hitting Divers or more mobile Juggernauts.

___

Jumping back to the "it's hard to itemize against Hybrid champs": Not really. Because Hybrid champs also have more difficulty itemizing for Penetration, so squishies are still more afraid of a pure AD *or* pure AP Assassin/Burst mage. And Tanks/Frontliners will just buy one MR+HP item and one Armor+HP item and will laugh at you.

Actually hybrid items and champions could be fine if they were designed as early game champions.... they get more power early from having AP and AD scalings but fall off later due to items like {{item:3031}} {{item:3089}} {{item:3135}} {{item:3036}} not really being as useful for hybrid champions

No, I still disagree with that.

First off, having two scalings doesn't make you scale twice as hard in early, you still need to buy every point of stats. Gunblade has more AD+AP than any pure AD or AP item, but it's more expansive than most and has no other stat on the side.

Second, even if that was true, that still means you lose the flexibility of being hybrid and having the possibility of choosing your build paths game by game, which is up to now the only good reason to be hybrid. So that would be a bad idea anyway.

I personally like Hybrid champions because, when they are balanced correctly, both their abilities and Auto-Attacks are as important.

ADCs tend to either build full-crit or pure lethality, making them essentially focused on only AA or their abilities.

AD bruisers somewhat value both things, but they generally build only 1-2 damage items, and then full-tank. No real room for options. 

Assassins generaly have a combo of abilities that has the potential to burst squishies, but, sometimes, they require AAs to execute the target. Best assassin players know how to mix AAs in their combos, so that they don't prolong the fight for too long. One of the few classes that I would say it values both abilities and AAs, whether they go full AD or full AP.

Most Mages don't AA at all. There are Kayle, Kennen, Twisted Fate and Teemo. Kayle, Kennen and Teemo are really old and went through a lot of weird builds. Twisted is the only Mage who I believe that plays like a Hybrid without building any hybrid stuff.

I want some champions with abilities and AAs on the same level of impact, and Hybrid items generally tend to enchant this play style.

That's an interesting point.

I'd argue that most AD melee are like that, though. Fiora, Yasuo, Riven, Jayce, Pantheon, etc. On the AP side, Diana is also like that, and she's technically not an Assassin.

You don't need your champ to be Hybrid, and you especially don't need hybrid items to care about both autos and abilities. (In case you didn't read my other comments in that sub-thread, I have nothing against Hybrid Champs, but my point is that Hybrid **Items** are a bad thing, EVEN if you want to support Hybrid Champs.)
